Text.Value: Florrick. The Fist would make an example of her - a shame if she were to mysteriously vanish from her cell.
I enjoy the spectacle of a hanging, but if our enemies accuse Florrick of treachery, she may be a useful ally.
*She will be executed four days hence.*
Florrick. We've got to help her.
Florrick's will be hanged. Unless you'd care to intervene.
*She will be executed three days hence.*
*She will be executed two days hence.*
Shit. Florrick's a true friend and ally - we can't let them hang her.
*The execution of Florrick, convicted traitor and seditionist, has been delayed for an indeterminate time.*
*She will be executed by the light of tomorrow's sun.*
Florrick's done for unless someone helps her soon.
Florrick's fate may not yet be sealed, if we care to intervene.
Florrick's going to be hung?... Hanged?... Either way, it doesn't sound good.
Alas, poor Florrick... I have no idea who that is.
A scaffold awaits Florrick. Perhaps we can free her.
*Florrick, former advisor to Duke Ravengard, has been found guilty of treacherous and seditious activity against the people of Baldur's Gate.*
*A scrawled note at the bottom reads: 'Vandalisation of official documentation is a crime. Kindly cease destroying these notices.'*
*She will be executed five days hence.*

Synopsis:
All lines here should be short!
Several posters can be found across the city announcing the impending execution of Florrick. With every longrest taken ever since the player party KNOWS about the execution we count down 1 day. When any poster is destroyed the funny addendum line is played as well. When the execution is bound to happen next day a rnadom party member reacts ONCE. Poster are gone when the execution happened. The posters claim the xecution is "postponed" when Florrick is saved from the prison.
